header_summary: Tom Briar suggests dropping the grinding of lock time in transactions and focusing on grinding block height instead, potentially saving bytes. ZmnSCPxj expresses initial interest in sidechains as a scaling solution but realizes they may create more blockchains that cannot scale. They propose using Lightning as a non-blockchain mechanism for scaling. Nick Farrow discusses a draft scheme for blinding and FROST compatibility, emphasizing the need for security assessment. Bastien TEINTURIER explains that Runes/macaroons protect specific RPCs but not compromised machines. Olaoluwa Osuntokun introduces a bLIP for mapping the Taproot Asset Protocol onto the BOLT channel/invoice format, enabling multi-hop payments. Greg Sanders highlights the importance of PTLCs in taproot channels and provides detailed information on GitHub.

recent_posts.title: Compressed Bitcoin Transactions
recent_posts.summary:
- Currently, the system drops significant bits to handle non-zero lock time in transactions.
- Adding more fields to the process can increase decompression time significantly and should be avoided.
- Tom suggests grinding the block height instead of the lock time to save space.

recent_posts.title: Sentinel Chains: A Novel Two-Way Peg
recent_posts.summary:
- The sender expresses initial interest in sidechains as a scaling solution for blockchains but realizes their limited scalability.
- They suggest integrating useful features developed on sidechains into the "real" Bitcoin.
- The sender proposes a federated sidechain for developing and prototyping features, and suggests considering the "mainstake" concept.

recent_posts.title: Private Collaborative Custody with FROST
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses a draft scheme explaining blinding and FROST compatibility.
- The scheme involves obtaining a public nonce, creating an aggregate FROST nonce, and calculating a challenge.
- Participants sign the challenge, creating partial signatures that combine to form a complete Schnorr signature.

recent_posts.title: Remotely control your lightning node from your favorite HSM
recent_posts.summary:
- Runes/macaroons are not effective in protecting compromised machines issuing RPCs.
- Specific RPCs involving payments are protected by Runes/macaroons, but not "read" RPCs.
- Users can customize the configuration of Runes/macaroons for desired protection levels.

recent_posts.title: blip-0029: Taproot Asset Protocol Channels
recent_posts.summary:
- A programmer has published a draft bLIP describing how to map Taproot Assets onto the BOLT channel/invoice format.
- The bLIP introduces support for holding and transferring assets created by the Taproot Assets Protocol.
- An RFQ last-mile negotiation scheme is used to enable multi-hop payments using Taproot Assets edge liquidity.

recent_posts.title: Practical PTLCs, a little more concretely
recent_posts.summary:
- Greg discusses the importance of PTLCs and shares a gist on GitHub.
- He examines message details in PTLCs and considers various factors for compatibility.
- Greg suggests his information can lead to discussions and invites feedback from recipients.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- We are implementing a blinded version of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains.
- The server (party 1) will be blinded and won't learn important information.
- Security relies on trusting the statechain server, and the set of signatures is verified client-side.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- Based on various factors, the storage for blockchain is sufficient, even without pruning.
- A 5TB hard drive, costing less than $150, can provide 21 years of storage space.
- Ongoing optimization efforts and affordable hardware make blockchain storage practical and sufficient.

active_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala has presented a complete proposal for the core opcodes of MATT.
- The proposal includes an improved implementation with details and functional tests.
- The new opcode, OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY, achieves the full generality of MATT with just two opcodes.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a new way to make lightning channels resumable from a wallet seed, addressing backup and channel operation issues.
- It suggests a new type of channel funding transaction with additional spending paths.
- The proposal includes the use of fraud proofs, discusses bandwidth optimization, and alternative options.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2024 Organization
active_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard, a Lightning Network developer, proposes organizing the LN Summit in Africa.
- Africa's cultural richness, fragmented financial systems, and growing Lightning developers make it an ideal location.
- Antoine seeks objections or feedback and emphasizes transparency and accountability in the open-source community.

active_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
active_posts.summary:
- We are proceeding with the plan to conduct a "dry run" of HTLC endorsement and local reputation tracking.
- The plan includes collecting data, propagating an experimental TLV, and implementing local reputation algorithms.
- Privacy is prioritized, and node operators are encouraged to participate in data collection.
